form.longName: PhenX PX090602 - Exercise Capacity Sixminute Walk Test
form.preferredDefinition: The six-minute walk test is timed and requires minimal technical resources to measure the distance that a patient can quickly walk on a flat, hard surface in a period of 6 minutes (the six-minute walk distance, 6MWD). This measure has been shown to be a reproducible, objective indicator of functional capacity and is a part of the multicomponent BODE index (body mass index, airflow obstruction, dyspnea, and exercise capacity) that correlates with survival. It is important to emphasize that in patients with more severe disease, this is a test of maximum exercise performance; subjects should receive standardized instructions and be encouraged to push themselves to achieve maximal distance.

question.questionText: Did the subject experience unstable angina during the previous month and myocardial infarction during the previous month? (exercise_capacity_angina_myocardial_infarction)
Is the subject's resting heart rate above 120bpm, systolic blood pressure above 180 mm Hg, and diastolic blood pressure above 100 mm Hg? (exercise_capacity_resting_heart_rate_blood_pressure)

If the subject answered yes, was the subject referred to a physician for assessment and a decision about the conduct of the test? (exercise_capacity_resting_heart_rate_blood_pressure_physician_referral)
Is a rapid, appropriate response to an emergency possible at the current testing location? (exercise_capacity_rapid_response_emergency_testing_location)
Are the following supplies available during testing? Oxygen, sublingual nitroglycerine, aspirin, albuterol (exercise_capacity_available_oxygen_nitroglycerine_aspirin_albuterol)

Is the technician certified in cardiopulmonary resuscitation with a minimum of Basic Life Supprt by an American Health Association-approved CPR course? (exercise_capacity_technician_cpr_basic_life_support)
If yes, does the subject have advanced cardiac life support certification? (exercise_capacity_technician_cpr_advanced_certification)
Is the patient on chronic oxygen therapy? (exercise_capacity_patient_chronic_oxygen_therapy)

Is the patient experiencing chest pain, intolerable dyspnea, leg cramps, staggering, diaphoresis, have pale or ashen appearance, or have SpO2 < 80% when continuous oximetry is available? (exercise_capacity_patient_chest_pain_dyspnea_leg_cramps_diaphoresis_oxygen)

If the test was stopped, were the following assessments performed on the patient? Blood pressure, pulse rate, oxygen saturation, physician evaluation (exercise_capacity_blood_pressure_pulse_rate_oxygen_saturation_physician_evaluation)
Was the walking course 30 meters in length with no bends or pedestrian traffic? (exercise_capacity_walking_course)
Is the test subject wearing comfortable clothing and appropriate shoes for walking? (exercise_capacity_subject_clothing_shoes)
Is the test subject using a walking aid during the test? (exercise_capacity_subject_walking_aid)
Has the test subject exercised vigorously within 2 hours of beginning the test? (exercise_capacity_subject_exercise_vigorously)
If this is repeat testing, was repeat testing performed about the same time of day? (exercise_capacity_repeat_testing)
Lap counter (exercise_capacity_lap_counter)
Patient name (exercise_capacity_patient_number)
Patient ID # (exercise_capacity_patient_id)
Walk # (exercise_capacity_walk_number)
Tech ID (exercise_capacity_technician_id)
Date (exercise_capacity_date)
Gender (exercise_capacity_patient_gender)
Age (exercise_capacity_patient_age)
Race (exercise_capacity_patient_race)
Height (in feet) (exercise_capacity_patient_height_feet)
Height (in inches) (exercise_capacity_patient_height_inches)
Height (in meters) (exercise_capacity_patient_height_meters)
Weight (in pounds) (exercise_capacity_patient_weight_pounds)
Weight (in kilograms) (exercise_capacity_patient_weight_kilograms)
Blood pressure (systolic) (exercise_capacity_patient_blood_pressure_systolic)
Blood pressure (diastolic) (exercise_capacity_patient_blood_pressure_diastolic)
Medications taken before the test (dose) (exercise_capacity_patient_medications_dose)
Medications taken before the test (time) (exercise_capacity_patient_medications_time)
Supplemental oxygen during the test (exercise_capacity_patient_supplemental_oxygen)
Baseline - Time (exercise_capacity_patient_baseline_time)
Baseline - Heart rate (exercise_capacity_patient_baseline_heart_rate)
Baseline - Dyspnea (Borg Scale) (exercise_capacity_patient_baseline_dyspnea)
Baseline - Fatigue (Borg Scale) (exercise_capacity_patient_baseline_fatigue)
Baseline - SpO2 (exercise_capacity_patient_baseline_oxygen_saturation)
End of test - Time (exercise_capacity_patient_end_time)
End of test - Heart rate (exercise_capacity_patient_end_heart_rate)
End of test - Dyspnea (Borg Scale) (exercise_capacity_patient_end_dyspnea)
End of test - Fatigue (Borg Scale) (exercise_capacity_patient_end_fatigue)
End of test - SpO2 (exercise_capacity_patient_end_oxygen_saturation)
Stopped or paused before 6 minutes (exercise_capacity_exercise_stop_six_minutes)
Stopped or paused before 6 minutes; reason: (exercise_capacity_exercise_stop_six_minutes_reason)
Other symptoms at end of exercise (exercise_capacity_exercise_symptoms)
Total distance walked in 6 minutes (Number of laps * 60 meters + final partial lap (in meters)) (exercise_capacity_total_distance)
Predicted distance (exercise_capacity_predicted_distance)
Percent predicted (exercise_capacity_predicted_distance_percent)
Tech comments (exercise_capacity_technician_comments)
If pulse oximetry is performed, what is the baseline heart rate? (exercise_capacity_pulse_oximetry_baseline_heart_rate)
If pulse oximetry is performed, what is the baseline oxygen saturation (SpO2)? (exercise_capacity_pulse_oximetry_baseline_oxygen_saturation)
How would you rate the baseline dyspnea using the Borg scale of the patient? (exercise_capacity_baseline_dyspnea_rating)
How would you rate the overall fatigue using the Borg scale of the patient? (exercise_capacity_overall_fatigue_rating)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The six-minute walk test is timed and requires minimal technical resources to measure the distance that a patient can quickly walk on a flat, hard surface in a period of 6 minutes (the six-minute walk distance, 6MWD). This measure has been shown to be a reproducible, objective indicator of functional capacity and is a part of the multicomponent BODE index (body mass index, airflow obstruction, dyspnea, and exercise capacity) that correlates with survival. It is important to emphasize that in patients with more severe disease, this is a test of maximum exercise performance; subjects should receive standardized instructions and be encouraged to push themselves to achieve maximal distance.

form.longName: PhenX PX121801 - Anxiety Disorders Symptoms Children Parent Report
form.preferredDefinition: The Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED) is a 41-item, self- or parent-report questionnaire designed to screen for childhood anxiety disorders, including general anxiety disorder, separation anxiety disorder, panic disorder, social phobia, and symptoms related to school phobias in children aged 8-17. Each item is rated on a 3-point Likert-scale (0 = Not True or Hardly Ever True; 1 = Somewhat True or Sometimes True; 2 = Very True or Often True).

protocol.longName: Anxiety Disorders Symptoms - Children - Parent Report
protocol.preferredDefinition: The Screen for Child Anxiety Related Emotional Disorders (SCARED) is a 41-item, self- or parent-report questionnaire designed to screen for childhood anxiety disorders, including general anxiety disorder, separation anxiety disorder, panic disorder, social phobia, and symptoms related to school phobias in children aged 8-17. Each item is rated on a 3-point Likert-scale (0 = Not True or Hardly Ever True; 1 = Somewhat True or Sometimes True; 2 = Very True or Often True).

form.preferredDefinition: The Major Experiences and Everyday Discrimination Scales include 19 interviewer-administered, yes-or-no and frequency response category questions. The Major Experiences subscale includes 9 questions about employment, housing, and education; the Everyday Discrimination subscale includes 10 questions about interactions with other people, including courtesy, respect, and harassment. A follow-up question to "yes" responses is also administered to probe about the reason for the discrimination as being related to race, gender, age, religion, disability, and so forth.

question.questionText: At any time in your life, have you ever been unfairly fired? (discrimination_fired)
What do you think was the main reason for this experience? (discrimination_fired_reason)

validValue.meaningText: Some other aspect of your physical appearance
validValue.description: Some other aspect of your physical appearance

question.questionText: What do you think was the main reason for this experience? OTHER POSSIBLE CATEGORIES TO CONSIDER (discrimination_fired_reason_other)
What do you think was the main reason for this experience? OTHER POSSIBLE CATEGORIES TO CONSIDER (discrimination_fired_reason_string)
When was the last time this happened? (discrimination_fired_last_occurrence)
How many times has this happened during your lifetime? (discrimination_fired_lifetime_occurrence)
For unfair reasons, have you ever not been hired for a job? (discrimination_hired)
What do you think was the main reason for this experience? (discrimination_hired_reason)

validValue.meaningText: Some other aspect of your physical appearance
validValue.description: Some other aspect of your physical appearance

question.questionText: What do you think was the main reason for this experience? OTHER POSSIBLE CATEGORIES TO CONSIDER (discrimination_hired_reason_other)

When was the last time this happened? (discrimination_hired_last_occurrence)
How many times has this happened during your lifetime? (discrimination_hired_lifetime_occurrence)
Have you ever been unfairly denied a promotion? (discrimination_promotion)
What do you think was the main reason for this experience? (discrimination_promotion_reason)

validValue.meaningText: Some other aspect of your physical appearance

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Major Experiences and Everyday Discrimination Scales include 19 interviewer-administered, yes-or-no and frequency response category questions. The Major Experiences subscale includes 9 questions about employment, housing, and education; the Everyday Discrimination subscale includes 10 questions about interactions with other people, including courtesy, respect, and harassment. A follow-up question to "yes" responses is also administered to probe about the reason for the discrimination as being related to race, gender, age, religion, disability, and so forth.

form.longName: PhenX PX510303 - Patterns Of Substance Use - Adolescents
form.preferredDefinition: The Monitoring the Future (MTF) questions from this module address whether the respondent has ever smoked, drunk alcohol, or used various drugs and assesses the frequency of substance use in the last 30 days and last 12 months.

question.questionText: Have you ever smoked cigarettes? (SubstanceUse_Ever_Smoked_Cigarettes)
How frequently have you smoked cigarettes during the past 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_Smoking_Frequency)

validValue.meaningText: Less than one cigarette per day
validValue.description: Less than one cigarette per day

validValue.meaningText: One to five cigarettes per day
validValue.description: One to five cigarettes per day

validValue.meaningText: About one and one-half packs per day
validValue.description: About one and one-half packs per day

validValue.meaningText: Two packs or more per day
validValue.description: Two packs or more per day

question.questionText: Have you ever taken or used smokeless tobacco (snuff, plug, dipping tobacco, chewing tobacco, snus, dissolvable tobacco)? (SubstanceUse_Ever_SmokelessTobacco)
How frequently have you taken smokeless tobacco during the past 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_SmokelessTobacco_Frequency)

Next we want to ask you about drinking alcoholic beverages, including beer, wine, liquor, and any other beverage that contains alcohol. Have you ever had any alcoholic beverage to drink-more than just a few sips? (SubstanceUse_Ever_Drink_Alcohol)
On how many occasions have you had alcoholic beverages to drink - more than just a few sips in your lifetime? (SubstanceUse_Lifetime_Alcohol)
On how many occasions have you had alcoholic beverages to drink - more than just a few sips during the last 12 months? (SubstanceUse_PastYear_Alcohol)
On how many occasions have you had alcoholic beverages to drink - more than just a few sips during the last 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_Alcohol)

Think back over the LAST TWO WEEKS. How many times have you had five or more drinks in a row? (A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a shot glass or liquor, a mixed drink, etc.) (SubstanceUse_PastTwoWeeks_Five_Drinks)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used marijuana (weed, pot) or hashish (hash, hash oil) in your lifetime? (SubstanceUse_Lifetime_Marijuana_Hashish)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used marijuana (weed, pot) or hashish (hash, hash oil) during the last 12 months? (SubstanceUse_PastYear_Marijuana_Hashish)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used marijuana (weed, pot) or hashish (hash, hash oil) during the last 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_Marijuana_Hashish)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used LSD ("acid") in your lifetime? (SubstanceUse_Lifetime_LSD)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used LSD ("acid") during the last 12 months? (SubstanceUse_PastYear_LSD)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used LSD ("acid") during the last 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_LSD)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used hallucinogens other than LSD (like mescaline, peyote, 'shrooms' or psilocybin, PCP) in your lifetime? (SubstanceUse_Lifetime_Other_Hallucinogen)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used hallucinogens other than LSD (like mescaline, peyote, 'shrooms' or psilocybin, PCP) during the last 12 months? (SubstanceUse_PastYear_Other_Hallucinogen)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used hallucinogens other than LSD (like mescaline, peyote, 'shrooms' or psilocybin, PCP) during the last 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_Other_Hallucinogen)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine (sometimes called 'coke,' 'crack', 'rock') if your lifetime? (SubstanceUse_Lifetime_Cocaine)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine (sometimes called 'coke,' 'crack', 'rock') during the last 12 months? (SubstanceUse_PastYear_Cocaine)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine (sometimes called 'coke,' 'crack', 'rock') during the last 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_Cocaine)

On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine in any other form in your lifetime? (SubstanceUse_Lifetime_Other_Cocaine)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine in any other form during the last 12 months? (SubstanceUse_PastYear_Other_Cocaine)
On how many occasions (if any) have you used cocaine in any other form during the last 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_Other_Cocaine)

On how many occasions (if any) have you taken amphetamines or other prescription stimulant drugs on your own—that is, without a doctor telling you to take them in your lifetime? (SubstanceUse_Lifetime_Amphetamines)

On how many occasions (if any) have you taken amphetamines or other prescription stimulant drugs on your own—that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 12 months? (SubstanceUse_PastYear_Amphetamines)

On how many occasions (if any) have you taken amphetamines or other prescription stimulant drugs on your own—that is, without a doctor telling you to take them during the last 30 days? (SubstanceUse_PastMonth_Amphetamines)

form.longName: PhenX PX550702 - Unmet Need For Alcohol Or Drug Treatment
form.preferredDefinition: Respondents complete a set of self-administered questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) related to alcohol and drug treatment needs and service utilization.

module.longName: Unmet Need For Alcohol Or Drug Treatment
module.preferredDefinition: Unmet Need For Alcohol Or Drug Treatment

question.questionText: Have you ever gone anywhere or seen anyone for a reason that was related in any way to your use of medicines or drugs - a physician, counselor, Narcotics Anonymous, or any other community agency or professional? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_ever)
In your entire life, did you EVER go to a Narcotics or Cocaine Anonymous, Alcoholics Anonymous or any 12- Step meeting? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_twelve_step_meeting_ever)
Did you go there in the last 12 months? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_twelve_step_meeting_past_year)
For which medicines or drugs did you go there in the last 12 months? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_twelve_step_meeting_past_year_drugs)
Did you go there before 12 months ago, that is before last (Month one year ago)? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_twelve_step_meeting_prior_last_year)
For which medicines or drugs did you go there before 12 months ago? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_twelve_step_meeting_prior_last_year_drugs)
In your entire life, did you EVER go to a family services or another social service agency? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_social_service_ever)
Did you go there in the last 12 months? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_social_service_past_year)
For which medicines or drugs did you go there in the last 12 months? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_social_service_past_year_drugs)
Did you go there before 12 months ago, that is before last (Month one year ago)? (unmet_need_alcohol_drug_treatment_social_service_prior_last_year)

protocol.longName: Unmet Need for Alcohol or Drug Treatment
protocol.preferredDefinition: Respondents complete a set of self-administered questions from the National Epidemiologic Survey on Alcohol and Related Conditions-III (NESARC-III) related to alcohol and drug treatment needs and service utilization.

form.preferredDefinition: The Family Interview for Genetic Studies (FIGS) is a tool used by a trained interviewer to collect information about biological relatives of the subject who has a mental disorder. The interview is conducted with the relatives themselves and not through the subject. There are three parts to the FIGS. The General Screening Questions gather general information about all known relatives. The Face Sheet is completed for each of the first-degree relatives and any affected relatives. This abbreviated version of the FIGS includes only a Symptom Checklist for psychosis.

question.questionText: Does the participant have any brothers or sisters? (familyhistory_psychosis_pedigree_siblings)
Do all your siblings have the same mother and father as you? (familyhistory_psychosis_pedigree_siblings_yes)
For full biological siblings (brothers/sisters who have same mother and father as participant), where does the participant fall in birth order? (familyhistory_psychosis_pedigree_siblings_sameparents)
Does the participant have any children? (familyhistory_psychosis_pedigree_children)
What's the interview date? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_interview_date)
What is the family last name? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_lastname)
What is the family ID number? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_id)
What is the first, middle, and last name of the Informant? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_informant_name)
What is the Informant's ID number? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_informant_id)
Was anyone adopted? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_adopted)
Was anyone mentally retarded? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_mental_retardation)
Have problems with their nerves or emotions? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_nerves)
Take medicine or see a doctor for it? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_nerves_medication)
Take lithium? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_nerves_lithium)
Feel very low for a couple of weeks or more, or have a diagnosis of depression? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_depression)
Attempt or complete suicide? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_suicide)
Seem overexcited (or manic) day and night, or have a diagnosis of mania? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_mania)
Have visions, hear voices, or have beliefs that seem strange or unreal? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_visions)
Have unusual or bizarre behavior, or have a diagnosis of schizophrenia? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_schizophrenia)
Have trouble with the police, with completing school, or with keeping a job? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_trouble)
Have alcohol or drug use that caused problems (with health, family, job, or police)? Go to AA or NA, or have treatment for this? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_substance_abuse)
(Was anyone) hospitalized for psychiatric problems, or for drug or alcohol problems? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_hospitalization)
Have inherited medical diseases such as Huntington’s disease or seizure disorder or any other disorders of the brain or nervous system? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_inherited_disease)
(Did anyone) have few friends, or seem to be a loner? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_loner)
(Did anyone) seem odd or eccentric in behavior or appearance? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_behavior)
(Was anyone) extremely jealous, or suspicious, or believe in magic, or see special meanings in things that no one else saw? (familyhistory_psychosis_generalscreening_delusion)
What's the interview date? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_interview_date)
What is the family last name? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_lastname)
What is the family ID number? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_id)
What is the first, middle, and last name of the Informant? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_informant_name)
What is the Informant's ID number? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_informant_id)
What is the first, middle, and last name of the person being described? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_subject_name)
What is the ID number of the person being described? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_subject_id)
What is the subject's relationship to the Informant? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_relationship)
What is the birthdate of the person described? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_subject_birthdate)
Is person described living? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_subject_living)
Age when subject last seen or known about, or died (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_lastknown_age)
Year when subject last seen or known about, or died (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_lastknown_date)
If deceased, cause of death (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_cause_death)
Did the subject commit suicide? (familyhistory_psychosis_figs_suicide)
What's the interview date? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_interview_date)
What is the first, middle, and last name of the Informant? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_informant_name)
What is the Informant's ID number? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_informant_id)
What is the first, middle, and last name of the person being described? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_subject_name)
What is the ID number of the person being described? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_subject_id)
Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). What were his/her unusual beliefs or experiences? Specify (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_beliefs)

Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever believe people were following him/her, or that someone was trying to hurt or poison him/her? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_harm)
Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever believe someone was reading his/her mind? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_mindreading)

Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever believe he/she was under the control of some outside person or power or force? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_outsidecontrol)

Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever believe his/her thoughts were broadcast, or that an outside force took away his/her thoughts or put thoughts into his/her head? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_broadcast_thoughts)
Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever have any other strange or unusual beliefs? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_otherbeliefs)
If Yes, describe (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_otherbeliefs_describe)
Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever see things that were not really there? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_hallucination_sight)
Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever hear voices or other sounds that were not real? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_hallucination_audio)
If Yes, describe (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_hallucination_describe)

(Code YES if: Voice with content having no relation to depression or elation, or voice keeping up running commentary on subject’s behavior or thoughts, or two or more voices conversing.) (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_hallucination_other)
Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever speak in a way that was difficult to make sense of? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_speech)
If Yes, describe (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_speech_describe)

Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever seem to be physically stuck in one position, or move around excitedly without any purpose? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_physical)
Code for a single episode (best recalled, worst episode if possible). Did he/she ever appear to have no emotions, or inappropriate emotions? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_emotions)
How long did the longest of these experiences last? In weeks (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_episode)
When any (SX above) happened, did he/she also have the mood disturbance we discussed before, at the same time? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_mood)
(Probe and code YES if mania and/or depression lasted at least 30% of total duration of illness described above, or medication for it.) (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_duration)
(Probe and code YES if illness described above, or medication for it, was ever present for as long as one week, without depression and/or mania.) (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_medication)
(Code YES if the above was true for as long as two weeks.) (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_twoweeks)
Code and describe professional treatment: (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_treatment)
Describe the treatment received. (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_treatment_inpatient)
Describe the treatment received. (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_treatment_outpatient)
Describe the treatment received. (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_treatment_ect)
Describe the treatment received. (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_treatment_medication)
Describe details and/or other treatment: (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_otherdetails)
What is the subject's age of onset? (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_onset)
Number of episodes (Code 001 if chronic symptoms and/or treatment since onset): (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_episodes)
Total illness duration (all episodes, includes active and prodromal and/or residual symptoms and/or treatment). (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_duration_weeks)
Total illness duration (all episodes, includes active and prodromal and/or residual symptoms and/or treatment). (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_duration_years)
Rate and code impairment or incapacitation: (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_rate_impairment)
Interviewer judgement on reliability of this information: (familyhistory_psychosis_psychosis_interviewer_judgement)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Family Interview for Genetic Studies (FIGS) is a tool used by a trained interviewer to collect information about biological relatives of the subject who has a mental disorder. The interview is conducted with the relatives themselves and not through the subject. There are three parts to the FIGS. The General Screening Questions gather general information about all known relatives. The Face Sheet is completed for each of the first-degree relatives and any affected relatives. This abbreviated version of the FIGS includes only a Symptom Checklist for psychosis.

form.longName: PhenX PX661001 - Psychiatric Symptoms Clinician Rated
form.preferredDefinition: The modified Colorado Symptom Index (CSI) is a 14-item, self-report scale designed to assess frequency of positive mood and cognitive symptoms. Items are rated on a 5-point Likert-style scale (Not at all, Once during the month, Several times during the month, Several times a week, at least every day). Each item is scored on a 0-4 scale (not at all = 0; at least every day = 4) and added together to give a score between 0 and 56, with higher scores indicating greater frequency of symptoms.

question.questionText: Have you been concerned about your physical health? (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern_health)
Have you had any physical illness or seen a medical doctor lately? (What does your doctor say is wrong? How serious is it?) (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern_illness)
Has anything changed regarding your appearance? (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern_appearance)
Has it interfered with your ability to perform your usual activities and/or work? (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern_dailyroutine)
Did you ever feel that parts of your body had changed or stopped working? (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern_function)
How often are you concerned about [use individual’s description]? (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern_frequency)
Have you expressed any of these concerns to others? (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern_others)
What is the rating based on the individual's self-report? (psychiatric_rating_somatic_concern)

validValue.meaningText: Very mild - Occasional somatic concerns that tend to be kept to self.
validValue.description: Very mild - Occasional somatic concerns that tend to be kept to self.

validValue.meaningText: Mild - Occasional somatic concerns that tend to be voiced to others (e.g., family, doctor).
validValue.description: Mild - Occasional somatic concerns that tend to be voiced to others (e.g., family, doctor).

validValue.meaningText: Moderate - Frequent expressions of somatic concern or exaggerations of existing ills OR some preoccupation, but no impairment in functioning. Not delusional.

validValue.meaningText: Moderately severe - Frequent expressions of somatic concern or exaggerations of existing ills OR some preoccupation and moderate impairment of functioning. Not delusional.

protocol.preferredDefinition: The modified Colorado Symptom Index (CSI) is a 14-item, self-report scale designed to assess frequency of positive mood and cognitive symptoms. Items are rated on a 5-point Likert-style scale (Not at all, Once during the month, Several times during the month, Several times a week, at least every day). Each item is scored on a 0-4 scale (not at all = 0; at least every day = 4) and added together to give a score between 0 and 56, with higher scores indicating greater frequency of symptoms.

form.longName: PhenX PX750201 - Compliance With Cigarette Packaging And Labeling Policie
form.preferredDefinition: The National Cancer Institute’s U01 study "Maximizing State & Local Policies to Restrict Tobacco Marketing at Point of Sale" uses the "U01 Point of Sale: Pack Analysis Coding Training Manual" to provide guidance on the coding process for cigarette packs purchased during store audits. Data are collected on cigarette pack identifiers or product codes, general pack characteristics, tax stamps, promotions, and counterfeit packs.

module.longName: Compliance With Cigarette Packaging And Labeling Policie
module.preferredDefinition: Compliance With Cigarette Packaging And Labeling Policie

question.questionText: Enter Coder Name: (PackagingLabeling_Compliance_Identifier_Coder_Name)
Enter the state ID on the pack (PackagingLabeling_Compliance_Identifier_PackId_State)
Enter the county ID on the pack (PackagingLabeling_Compliance_Identifier_PackId_County)
Enter the store ID on the pack (PackagingLabeling_Compliance_Identifier_PackId_Store)
Use this section to record if you had to consult about the ID or anything else of note. (PackagingLabeling_Compliance_Identifier_Comments)
What brand is the cigarettes? (PackagingLabeling_Compliance_PackCharacteristics_Brand)
What brand is the cigarettes? (PackagingLabeling_Compliance_PackCharacteristics_Brand_Other)

protocol.longName: Compliance with Cigarette Packaging and Labeling Policies
protocol.preferredDefinition: The National Cancer Institute’s U01 study "Maximizing State & Local Policies to Restrict Tobacco Marketing at Point of Sale" uses the "U01 Point of Sale: Pack Analysis Coding Training Manual" to provide guidance on the coding process for cigarette packs purchased during store audits. Data are collected on cigarette pack identifiers or product codes, general pack characteristics, tax stamps, promotions, and counterfeit packs.
